sense.gloss: to catch, to capture, to seize, to arrest, to grab, to catch hold of
to grasp (e.g. meaning), to perceive, to capture (e.g. features)

sdata.j: ↑思考↑↓しこう↓と↑発話↑↓はつわ↓とが↑相互↑↓そうご↓↑依存↑↓いぞん↓することからわかるように、↑言語↑↓げんご↓は、↑既成↑↓きせい↓の↑事実↑↓じじつ↓を|↑捉↑↓とら↓える|ための↑手段↑↓しゅだん↓というよりも、↑未知↑↓みち↓なる↑真実↑↓しんじつ↓を↑見↑↓み↓つけ↑出↑↓だ↓すための↑手段↑↓しゅだん↓である。その↑多様↑↓たよう↓↑性↑↓せい↓は、↑音声↑↓おんせい↓や↑記号↑↓きごう↓ではなく↑世界↑↓せかい↓↑観↑↓かん↓の↑多様↑↓たよう↓↑性↑↓せい↓なのだ。
sdata.e: The interdependence of thought and speech makes it clear that languages are not so much a means of expressing truth that has already been established, but a means of discovering truth that was previously unknown. Their diversity is a diversity not of sounds and signs but of ways of looking at the world.

sdata.e: The clear and refreshing sound of the wind chimes is one of the characteristics of summers in Japan, but in recent years the number of people who perceive it merely as noise has been increasing.
